subject: Soccer
lead_paragraph: FIFA changed its ban on World Cup qualifying matches at high altitude yesterday, saying it would apply only to games above 9,840 feet. Citing medical concerns for players and an unfair home advantage for highland teams, FIFA last month prohibited international tournaments and World Cup qualifying matches in stadiums above 8,200 feet. The original ruling caused protests as it eliminated matches in the capitals of Bolivia, Colombia and Ecuador, and in the stadiums of teams in Peru, Chile and Mexico. The new ban applies only to World Cup qualifying matches. The ruling still prevents qualifying matches from being played in the Bolivian capital of La Paz.
